message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.SD

This paper is about generating texts from structured data using neural language models and encoder-decoder frameworks, which are commonly used in natural language processing tasks such as question answering and dialog systems. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which focuses on the intersection of computer science and linguistics. 

The paper also proposes an order-planning text generation model to capture the relationship between different fields and make the generated text more fluent and smooth. This involves modeling the order of contents during text generation, which is related to the sub-categories of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). 

Furthermore, the paper evaluates its proposed model on the WikiBio dataset, which is a large-scale dataset of biographical information. This is related to the sub-category of cs.IR (Information Retrieval), which deals with the organization and retrieval of large amounts of information. 

Finally, the paper uses metrics such as BLEU, ROUGE, and NIST scores to evaluate the performance of its proposed model. This is related to the sub-category of cs.SD (Sound and Music Computing), which deals with the evaluation and analysis of digital signals and data.
